In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a Julia function that wraps text into new lines:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end
        
        wrapped_text *= " $word"
        line_length += length(word) + 1 # for the space
    end
    
    return wrapped_text[2:end] # remove the leading whitespace
end
```

You can call this function with a string and `text_width` parameter like so:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Pellentesque id dui in nisl mollis ullamcorper.", 25))
```

This will output the text wrapped at each word that would exceed `text_width`, with a newline (`\n`) inserted between each line:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Pellentesque 
id dui in nisl mollis ullamcorper.
```
